data.title: Interviews – K Composite Magazine
data.text:
M

McKenzie Gordon

McKenzie Gordon is fascinated by serial killers and really hates it when people chew with their mouths open.

E

Emma Pettersson

You can’t talk about Emma without talking about the music that fuels her life. There is always music playing around her and most of it is heavy and loud.

F

Fredrik Vindelälv & Niclas Blixt Madison

Fredrik Vindelälv and Niclas Blixt Madison have worked together in the magazine business for eight years, which they both agree is “way too long.”

A

Angelica Olai

Angelica Olai met a priest in London who told her "things that nobody knows!"

I

Ingrid Eliasson

Ingrid has witnessed volumes of changes in relationships, lifestyles, language, weather and transportation in more than eight decades of an action-packed life in Stockholm.

E

Elin Gunnarsson

Elin's friend Anna volunteered her for a quick interview and in the short conversation we learned about the lack of open-casket funerals in Sweden.

S

Sarah Mattingly

Sarah Mattingly grew up on a farm in rural Kentucky and she has the accent to prove it.

L

Linn Larsson

Linn is the author of three Swedish cookbooks, which she also photographed and designed. Her tiny apartment is like a factory for creativity.

O

Olle Morin

Olle Morin talks about launching a dating website for creative people and doing other stuff simply because it needed to be done.

E

Erik Welén

Erik's first job was as a groundskeeper at a cemetery. He quickly learned that there are only certain parts of the casket you can stand on.

K

Karin Nilsson

Karin grew up in the area of Sweden where those red, wooden horses come from, but she feels like her life didn't really start until she moved to England.

L

Linnea Måhlén

Designer Linnea Måhlén invited me to her housewarming party which became so riotous that her neighbors immediately soured on her presence in the building.

M

Mary Sparr

Mary Sparr discusses her addiction to traveling and how she loves to go for it while sneezing.

C

Caroline Hainer

Caroline, who has lots of denim shirts and a few paintings of herself, is one of Sweden's resident experts on The Simpsons.

M

Moa Blomkvist

Moa Blomkvist discusses the situation that ensued after she accidentally became trapped in the luggage compartment of a bus that crossed the Malaysian border.

A

Alicia Cavender

These days, Alicia uses ringtones that came with her phone. "I used to get free ringtones with my old cell phone plan, and I used to have a bunch of ringtones then. Not anymore. Journey, Outkast, Neil Young... You know. All the hits!"

M

Mia Living

"When you first grow up and move away from home, you start getting to know yourself as a grown-up and what you can do with all of your endless possibilities."

J

Johanna Åhlberg

After finishing years of language and linguistics, Johanna is dreaming of a new future working with electricity.

M

Miles Harvey

When Miles Harvey was interviewed for K Composite in 1999, he was a senior in a high school located in the same building as the K Composite office. His goal at the time was to always wear ties and suits no matter where he was going.

J

Julia Lind

Julia's presence is at once heartwarming, indignant, endearing, prodding and hysterical. So much of everything she says is in the subtleties, nuances and colors of the way she says it. When transcribed into written words, most of it simply disappears with the sounds.

M

Mary Regal

Mary Regal is on an eternal hunt for the perfect avocado. That hunt is a horrible curse, because you don’t know you have the perfect avocado until you open it, but as soon as you open it you have to eat it. Then the search begins again.

M

Moa Junström

Moa is easily the only person I know who helps finance documentary filmmaking by working in a late-term care center for people with dementia.

J

Jenny Levallius

Jenny has worked in magazine design her entire adult life and was one of the world's pioneers in designing magazines for the iPad.

S

Sofia Talvik

Before she was 10 years old, Sofia Talvik was publishing her own magazine and selling it to her neighbors.

P

Patrick Masterson

Letterpress printer Patrick Masterson tells Jasmine Weatherby about his favorite dance moves and what he thinks everyone should take on a picnic.

T

Thommy Browne

From K Composite 14 Born 16 December 1976 in Louisville where he works as a web designer. Blue eyes. Favorite Atari game: Maze Craze. IF..

C

Carrie Butler

When we were practically kids, I interviewed Carrie for the second issue of my Xeroxed zine called K Composite.

A

Adrienne Isgrigg

Adrienne, who has a master's degree in Clinical Psychology, is fanatical about Star Trek and Harry Potter.

S

Stan Doll

A lot of people are enthusiastic about life, but most of those people are idiots. That's somehow not the case with Stan Doll.

C

Carla Wettig

The stealthily amazing Carla Wettig has sage advice for home buyers. "You don’t want to settle."

L

Louis Winner

Louis Winner realizes the irony of the fact that his three favorite animals are all basically the same: the wolf, the Siberian Husky and the German Sheperd.

R

Rachel Graham

Rachel Karen Graham claims to be “a jack of all trades, master of none.” In fact, she has mastered most of what she has attempted.Born..

J

Jessica Woolard

At 1.65 meters tall and a light 52 kilograms, Jessica Leanne Woolard is unflinching in her cynical honesty and is predominantly unconcerned with the opinions..

B

Brittany Frey

When she was in high school in 1999, Brittany Frey saw an ad seeking people to deliver stacks of K Composite Magazine to stores and..

D

Dear Hilary

This is an ongoing interview with Hilary Noltemeyer which has spanned many years.

L

Lauren Garrison

Lauren Garrison does her laundry every two weeks and loves chocolate. When she was in high school, despite being having a 3.75 grade point average, she was a real discipline case.

D

David Cook

Born October 12, 1972 at 4:13 am in Louisville, Kentucky. 187 cm, blue eyes, claims his weight is zero. Favorite Atari game: Pitfall! Dave Cook..

J

Joe Walker

Devoted film fan Joe Walker watches a lot of movies. In fact, that's about all he ever does. He pays attention, too, and is a veritable fountain of knowledge about the most trivial details of particular films.

R

Ryan Stearman

Ryan Stearman has an unusual sleeping schedule and was interviewed by Lauren Garrison in 2000.

J

John Carswell

John wrote to us in 2000, "Maybe it would be cool to interview me because I'm in the Navy." We agreed with that because we were curious. Joining the Navy is something that none of us would ever do.

K

Kate Middleton

Kate Middleton was a scholarship student at Xavier University in Cincinnati when interviewed in 1999 (in moving vehicle while making the 164-kilometer trip back to..

A

Abbey Bradford

Abbey Bradford lives in Lafayette, Indiana, a small city of about 60,000 which sits as an oasis roughly halfway between Indianapolis and Chicago.

R

Rob Suchan

Robert Franklin Suchan (pronounced SOO-kon) lives and goes to school in Bowling Green, Ohio. He has an interesting way of talking that sounds like someone..

A

Amy Riggs

Amy Riggs is a reluctant senior at Assumption High School. She is an actor and has performed in a number of plays there, in addition..

A

Alexis Lüscher

Alexis Luescher was interviewed in the summer of 1999 while working as a clerk at the Highlands-Shelby Park Library in Louisville

T

Ty Kreft

When interviewed in 2000, Mark Tyler Kreft was a 20-year-old Louisville graphic designer who claimed to be a "frickin' kick ass dude," but he didn't want you to think he was a "potty mouth."

R

Rachel Allen

Rachel Elizabeth Allen always watches movies until the end of the credits – or at least until the songs are listed.

C

Chris Reinstatler

Christopher Jason Reinstatler (whose friends call him “The Hört”) likes to have a good time and laugh about funny things. He often has a demeanor..

J

Jasmine Weatherby

Jasmine Weatherby was interviewed for K Composite in 2000 by Mark Brickey. At the time she said she enjoyed playing guitar for fun but never sang along.

L

Libby Ackerman

Libby is the child of a military father, so her youth was spent moving around a lot, including a stint of elementary school in Bonn, Germany. She still speaks German for fun with her Arkansas-native parents when they get together for lunch in Louisville.

T

Tom Husman

Born 18 March 1969 in Atlanta, Georgia Favorite Atari game: Asteroids When Tom Husman was interviewed for K Composite in 1999, his introduction in the..

K

Katherine Bilby

When interviewed for K Composite in October 1999, Katherine Bilby was a student at St. Francis High School. The private school is located in the..

C

Curtis Mead

Curtis Mead is kind of a wanderer. He used to play in a band which toured America and Europe several times, taking him far from his hometown of Carmel, Indiana, just outside Indianapolis.

S

Stephanie Teague

"I love tornadoes. I've always been scared shitless of them. It gives me this adrenaline rush and it's so awesome."

K

Kley Welsh

While working at The Gap in 1999, Kley Welsh stopped by the K Composite office in downtown Louisville to be subjected to the third degree.

J

Jim Suptic

Jim Suptic took a few minutes in 1999 to try to explain the concept of television to us.

M

Maiza Hixson

Several of Maiza's past roommates have complained of her using their dishes as containers for mixing paint and not cleaning the ones she uses for food.

J

Jason Noble

Jason Noble is the kind of person whose accomplishments are so vast and varied that their description is as ornery a literary task as could be mustered. He was interviewed for K Composite in 1996.

A

Alice Davenport

Alice was interviewed for K Composite in 1992 after having moved to Owensboro, Kentucky.

B

Bill Barbot

Bill Barbot participated in this written interview for K Composite in the spring of 1992. He makes chronic, hilarious use of numbered lists and quotation marks.

L

Layla Smith

When interviewed for K Composite in 1992, Layla Smith was described as: "a 19-year-old Collegiate graduate and a UofL drop-out who goes to punk shows and through some strange twist of fate became one of the five 1992 Kentucky Derby Festival Princesses."

C

Carrie Osborne

In the summer of 1992, Carrie Osborne was: “a 19-year-old Bellarmine College student. She schooled at Collegiate for 12 years and played field hockey there...

P

Peter Searcy

Late in 1991, Peter Searcy was interviewed in the first issue of K Composite.
